CLUE: A cloche (anag) - spiral cavity of the inner ear
FOUND IN: Cochlea: The cochlea is part of the inner ear and has a snail-like, or spiral shape that corresponds to the clue "a cloche" and represents a spiral cavity.
Grab - to take hold of something suddenly and forcefully, akin to the action described by snatch.
Exceed standard performance (excelling beyond normal benchmarks)
Flight: The act of running away from a place or situation quickly and often suddenly.
Reared - brought up or fostered in a particular environment
Chromium - A lustrous, hard, and brittle metal with high corrosion resistance, known for its bright silver-gray appearance, used in various alloys such as stainless steel (symbol Cr).
Sangria: A popular Spanish alcoholic punch made with red wine, chopped fruit, sugar, and a splash of brandy or orange-flavored liqueur.

CLUE: English poet, diplomat and customs official
FOUND IN: Geoffrey Chaucer - Known as the Father of English literature, he wrote "The Canterbury Tales," but also held diplomatic roles and was a customs official.
Wombat - A burrowing tailless marsupial, known for its stout appearance and strong digging abilities.
Wistful - Exhibiting a longing or nostalgia for past times; King Arthur often reminisces about his kingdom and its glory days.
Nelumbo nucifera (Indian lotus) - Although not a true water lily, it shares some similarities to the aquatic plants of the Nymphaeaceae family
